title: This surprising $5 Aldi item is fast becoming a cult buy
text:
A $5 cauliflower bake is fast becoming one of Aldi Australia's most popular buys, with hundreds of foodies raving about the budget snack on social media.

The cheesy bake, available in the frozen section of all Aldi stores, has been used by busy families as a quick dinner option, a simple daytime snack and even a pie filling using the famed Kmart Pie Maker.

'It’s a great meal to have in the freezer for emergencies when you just want a really yummy meal,' one mother wrote on Facebook.

A $5 cauliflower bake is fast becoming one of Aldi Australia's most popular buys, with hundreds of foodies raving about the budget snack on social media

Shoppers can also get their hands on a broccoli bake and a potato bake in the same section.

'I mix the cauliflower and broccoli together. Then you just add some extra Parmesan cheese and you're ready to go,' one shopper wrote.

'I mix all three - the cauliflower, the broccoli and the potato ones all together and it's amazing,' another wrote.

The cheesy bake, available in the frozen section of all Aldi stores, has been used by busy families as a quick dinner option, a simple daytime snack and even a pie filling using the famed Kmart Pie Maker

'It’s a great meal to have in the freezer for emergencies when you just want a really yummy meal,' one mother wrote on Facebook

Although the dish may seem like a healthy option, it does only come with a three-star health rating and should be part of a balanced meal.

Despite this, American food blogger Chef Resha, who follows the Keto diet, has previously said that high fat dishes like cauliflower and cheese have helped her lose 10 kilos.

'It's working, because I'm down over 10 kilos and continuing to melt. My energy is through the roof, clarity is my best friend, and I just get so much more done,' she said of her homemade dish.
description: A $5 cauliflower bake is fast becoming one of Aldi Australia's most popular buys, with hundreds of foodies raving about the budget snack on social media.
authors: Matilda Rudd For Daily Mail Australia
